statement.p: A random variable is a numerical measure of a probability experiment, so its value is determined by chance. Random variables are typically denoted by capital letters such as X or Y.
A discrete random variable has either a finite or countable number of values.
A continuous random variables has infinitely many values.

The probability distribution of a discrete random variable X provides the possible values of the random variable and their corresponding probabilities. A probability distribution can be in the form of a table, graph, or mathematical formula.
\sum P(x) = 1
0 \le P(x) \le 1

fact.title: The Mean of a Discrete Random Variable

statement.p:
\mu_X = \sum \left[ x\cdot P(x)\right]
where x is the value of the random variable X, and P(x) is the probability of observing the value x.

example.title: Mean Number of People in Household
example.p:
The formula for computing the mean of a discrete random variable is equivalent to how we compute the average. For example, a small class of statistics students was asked how many people live in their households. The following data was obtained:
2, 4, 6, 6, 4, 4, 2, 3, 5, 5
What is the mean or average number of people per household?

remark.title: Interpretation of the Mean
remark.p:
Suppose an experiment is repeated n times, and the measurements of the random variable X are labeled: x_1, x_2, \ldots, x_n then as n goes to infinity, we expect the average of all measurements, \overline{x}, to get closer and closer to \mu_X:
\text{as } n \to \infty \qquad \mu_X - \overline{x} \to 0.
where
\overline{x} = \frac{x_1 + x_2 + \cdots + x_n}{n}.
In other words, the mean of a random variable represents what we would expect the average value of all the measurements to be in the long run, if we do the experiment many times.

fact.title: The Standard Deviation of a Discrete Random Variable

statement.p:
\sigma_X = \sqrt{\sum \left[ (x-\mu_X)^2 \cdot P(x)\right]}
where x is the value of the random variable X, \mu_X is the mean of the random variable, and P(x) is the probability of observing the value x.

reading-questions.title: Expected Value of a Straight Bet in Roulette
reading-questions.p: In the game of Roulette, a player can place a $1 bet on the number 17. This is called a straight bet. Since the wheel has pockets numbered 136, 0, and 00, there is a 1/38 chance the ball will land on 17. If the ball lands on 17, the player will win $36 (36 times the value of the bet). Win or lose, the casino takes the player's $1 bet.

statement.p: What is the expected value of the game for the player?
